tool.name: PAUSE:Base
tool.description: Pile-up Analysis Using Starts & Ends. Reads Illumina/454 Data and attempts to determine possible genome ends based on that data.
tool.command:
bin/pause_analysis.pl --galaxy --outfile_supporting $__new_file_path__ --bam_sense "${bam_sense}"
--bam_antisense "${bam_antisense}"
#if $bai_sense and $bai_sense is not "None": --bai_sense "${bai_sense}" #end if
#if $bai_antisense and $bai_antisense is not "None": --bai_antisense "${bai_antisense}" #end if
--genome "${genome}"
#if $starts_threshold and $starts_threshold is not "None": --starts_threshold "${starts_threshold}" #end if
--pause "${pause}" --pause_files_path "${pause.files_path}" --pause_format "${pause_format}" --pause_id "${pause.id}"
--pause_info "${pause_info}" --pause_info_files_path "${pause_info.files_path}" --pause_info_format "${pause_info_format}" --pause_info_id "${pause_info.id}"

param.name: bam_sense
param.help: BAM aligned reads on Sense Strand
param.label: bam_sense

param.name: bam_antisense
param.help: BAM aligned reads on Antisense Strand
param.label: bam_antisense

param.name: bai_sense
param.help: BAI - bam index for Sense Strand
param.label: bai_sense

param.name: bai_antisense
param.help: BAI - bam index for Antisense Strand
param.label: bai_antisense

param.name: starts_threshold
param.help: SNR threshold in CWT for starts
param.label: starts_threshold

tool.help:
DESCRIPTION ===========
PAUSE:Analysis is a tool to run peak finding on BAM alignments. Uses genome for sequence information surrounding peaks.
This tool takes a mapped alignment of sequencing data and uses that data for CWT (Continuous Wavelet Transform) analysis in R in order to identify peaks.
PARAMETERS ==========
- ``bam_sense`` bam file of reads mapping to sense strand - ``bai_sense`` bam index for ``bam_sense`` - ``bam_antisense`` bam file of reads mapping to antisense strand - ``bai_antisense`` bam index for ``bam_antisense`` - ``genome`` fasta sequence of the genome - ``starts_threshold`` this parameter is the signal to noise ratio for the peak detection algorithm. 10 seems to be a good value for phages, but try adjusting downwards if you are finding too few peaks. Once you've settled on a good value and found reasonable looking peaks, confer with the PAUSE:Base plot to identify your end type.
KNOWN BUGS ==========
- Currently the position used in the header label is incorrect. Use the number as seen in the histogram for accurate start/end position information. - Information is incorrect around start/end of the genome, as reads that are off either end do not map correctly. We will probably eventually add "circular genome" assumptions which will duplicate a portion of the genome on each for better mapping results.
